{"step_by_step_thinking": "Postpartum hemorrhage is a common complication of childbirth and can be managed with several medications. Misoprostol is a prostaglandin E1 analogue that can be used to prevent and treat postpartum hemorrhage. Dinoprostone is a naturally occurring prostaglandin E2, which is used to induce labor but not typically used in the management of postpartum hemorrhage. Prostaglandin F2 alpha is used to contract the uterus and control postpartum hemorrhage. Oxytocin is a hormone that can cause the uterus to contract and is commonly used to prevent and treat postpartum hemorrhage.", "answer_choice": "B. Dinoprostone"}
